definitions.definition: Deficiency in amount or quality; a falling short; lack.
A situation wherein, or amount whereby, spending exceeds government revenue.
A statement of the meaning of a word or word group or a sign or symbol (dictionary definitions).
(usually with the definite article the) A clear instance conforming to the dictionary or textbook definition.
A statement expressing the essential nature of something; formulation
The action or process of defining.
The act of defining; determination of the limits.
A product of defining.
The action or power of describing, explaining, or making definite and clear.
definitions.example: Her comic genius is beyond definition.

definitions.definition: Clarity of visual presentation, distinctness of outline or detail.
definitions.example: Improve the definition of an image.

definitions.definition: Clarity, especially of musical sound in reproduction.
Sharp demarcation of outlines or limits.
definitions.example: A jacket with distinct waist definition.

definitions.definition: The degree to which individual muscles are distinct on the body.
A statement which provides a previous declaration with a value or body of a subroutine (in the case of function).
A statement that establishes the referent of a term or notation.
Without question and beyond doubt.
definitions.example: Joe definitely doesn't know how to drive a tractor.

definitions.definition: In a definite manner; decisively.
Excellent; very good
A person with poor judgment or little intelligence.
definitions.example: The village fool threw his own shoes down the well.

definitions.definition: A jester; a person whose role was to entertain a sovereign and the court (or lower personages).
Someone who derives pleasure from something specified.
Buddy, dude, man.
A type of dessert made of puréed fruit and custard or cream.
definitions.example: an apricot fool; a gooseberry fool

definitions.definition: (often capitalized, Fool) A particular card in a tarot deck, representing a jester.
To trick; to deceive
To act in an idiotic manner; to act foolishly
Foolish.
The act of returning.
definitions.example: I expect the house to be spotless upon my return.

definitions.definition: A return ticket.
definitions.example: Do you want a one-way or a return?

definitions.definition: An item that is returned, e.g. due to a defect, or the act of returning it.
definitions.example: Last year there were 250 returns of this product, an improvement on the 500 returns the year before.

definitions.definition: An answer.
definitions.example: a return to one's question

definitions.definition: An account, or formal report, of an action performed, of a duty discharged, of facts or statistics, etc.; especially, in the plural, a set of tabulated statistics prepared for general information.
definitions.example: election returns; a return of the amount of goods produced or sold

definitions.definition: Gain or loss from an investment.
definitions.example: It yielded a return of 5%.

definitions.definition: : A report of income submitted to a government for purposes of specifying exact tax payment amounts. A tax return.
definitions.example: Hand in your return by the end of the tax year.

definitions.definition: A carriage return character.
The act of relinquishing control to the calling procedure.
A return value: the data passed back from a called procedure.
A return pipe, returning fluid to a boiler or other central plant (compare with flow pipe, which carries liquid away from central plant).
definitions.example: The boiler technician had to cut out the heating return to access the safety valve.

definitions.definition: A short perpendicular extension of a desk, usually slightly lower.
Catching a ball after a punt and running it back towards the opposing team.
A throw from a fielder to the wicket-keeper or to another fielder at the wicket.

The continuation in a different direction, most often at a right angle, of a building, face of a building, or any member, such as a moulding; applied to the shorter in contradistinction to the longer.
definitions.example: A facade of sixty feet east and west has a return of twenty feet north and south.

definitions.definition: To come or go back (to a place or person).
definitions.example: Although the birds fly north for the summer, they return here in winter.

definitions.definition: To go back in thought, narration, or argument.
definitions.example: To return to my story [...]

definitions.definition: To turn back, retreat.
To turn (something) round.
To place or put back something where it had been.
definitions.example: Please return your hands to your lap.

definitions.definition: To give something back to its original holder or owner.
definitions.example: You should return the library book within one month.

definitions.definition: To take back something to a vendor for a refund.
definitions.example: If the goods don't work, you can return them.

definitions.definition: To give in requital or recompense; to requite.
To bat the ball back over the net in response to a serve.
definitions.example: The player couldn't return the serve because it was so fast.

definitions.definition: To play a card as a result of another player's lead.
definitions.example: If one players plays a trump, the others must return a trump.

definitions.definition: To throw a ball back to the wicket-keeper (or a fielder at that position) from somewhere in the field.
To say in reply; to respond.
definitions.example: to return an answer;  to return thanks;  "Do it yourself!" she returned.

definitions.definition: To relinquish control to the calling procedure.
To pass (data) back to the calling procedure.
definitions.example: This function returns the number of files in the directory.

definitions.definition: To retort; to throw back.
definitions.example: to return the lie

definitions.definition: To report, or bring back and make known.
definitions.example: to return the result of an election

definitions.definition: (by extension) To elect according to the official report of the election officers.
(etc.) A set of keys used to operate a typewriter, computer etc.
A component of many instruments including the piano, organ, and harpsichord consisting of usually black and white keys that cause different tones to be produced when struck.
A device with keys of a musical keyboard, used to control electronic sound-producing devices which may be built into or separate from the keyboard device.
To type on a computer keyboard.
definitions.example: Keyboarding is the part of this job I hate the most.

definitions.definition: To change part of.
To be or become modified.
To set bounds to; to moderate.
(grammar) To qualify the meaning of.
A type of large constricting snake.
Penis
(of people)
(of capabilities)
(properties and qualities)
(when with and) Very, extremely. See good and.
definitions.example: The soup is good and hot.

definitions.definition: Holy (especially when capitalized) .
definitions.example: Good Friday

definitions.definition: (of quantities)
That is good; an elliptical exclamation of satisfaction or commendation.
definitions.example: Good! I can leave now.

definitions.definition: Well; satisfactorily or thoroughly.
definitions.example: The boy done good. (did well)

definitions.definition: The forces or behaviours that are the enemy of evil. Usually consists of helping others and general benevolence.
A result that is positive in the view of the speaker.
The abstract instantiation of goodness; that which possesses desirable qualities, promotes success, welfare, or happiness, is serviceable, fit, excellent, kind, benevolent, etc.
definitions.example: The best is the enemy of the good.

definitions.definition: (usually in the plural) An item of merchandise.
To thrive; fatten; prosper; improve.
To make good; turn to good; improve.
To make improvements or repairs.
To benefit; gain.
To do good to (someone); benefit; cause to improve or gain.
To satisfy; indulge; gratify.
To flatter; congratulate oneself; anticipate.
To furnish with dung; manure; fatten with manure; fertilise.
A globally scoped identifier.
Concerning all parts of the world.
definitions.example: Pollution is a global problem.

definitions.definition: Pertaining to the whole of something; total, universal:
Spherical, ball-shaped.
definitions.example: In the center was a small, global mass.

definitions.definition: Of or relating to a globe or sphere.
In the global manner; world-wide.
The act of connecting.
The point at which two or more things are connected.
definitions.example: My headache has no connection with me going out last night.

definitions.definition: A feeling of understanding and ease of communication between two or more people.
definitions.example: As we were the only people in the room to laugh at the joke, I felt a connection between us.

definitions.definition: An established communications or transportation link.
definitions.example: I was talking to him, but there was lightning and we lost the connection.

definitions.definition: A transfer from one transportation vehicle to another in scheduled transportation service
definitions.example: The bus was late so he missed his connection at Penn Station and had to wait six hours for the next train.

definitions.definition: A kinship relationship between people.
An individual who is related to oneself, through either family or business.
definitions.example: I have some connections in Lancashire.

definitions.definition: A set of sets that contains the empty set, all one-element sets for any element that is included in any of the sets, and the union of any group of sets that are elements where the intersections of those sets is non-empty.
Coherence; lack of disjointedness
The description for a Methodist denomination as a whole, as opposed to its constituent churches, circuits, districts and conferences.
Sexual intercourse
An uncertainty, possibility, condition, doubt etc.
Supposing that, assuming that, in the circumstances that; used to introduce a condition or choice.
definitions.example: If it rains, I shall get wet.

definitions.definition: In the event that a statement is true (a programming statement that acts in a similar manner).
definitions.example: If A, then B, else C.

definitions.definition: Supposing that; used with past or past perfect subjunctive indicating that the condition is closed.
definitions.example: I would be unhappy if you had not talked with me yesterday.

definitions.definition: Supposing that; given that; supposing it is the case that.
definitions.example: If that's true, we had better get moving!

definitions.definition: Although; used to introduce a concession.
definitions.example: He was a great friend, if a little stingy at the bar.

definitions.definition: (sometimes proscribed) Whether; used to introduce a noun clause, an indirect question, that functions as the direct object of certain verbs.
definitions.example: I don't know if I want to go or not.

definitions.definition: (usually hyperbolic) Even if; even in the circumstances that.
Introducing a relevance conditional.
definitions.example: I have leftover cake if you want some.

definitions.definition: A reference work with a list of words from one or more languages, normally ordered alphabetically, explaining each word's meaning, and sometimes containing information on its etymology, pronunciation, usage, translations, and other data.
(preceded by the) A synchronic dictionary of a standardised language held to only contain words that are properly part of the language.
(by extension) Any work that has a list of material organized alphabetically; e.g., biographical dictionary, encyclopedic dictionary.
An associative array, a data structure where each value is referenced by a particular key, analogous to words and definitions in a physical dictionary.
To look up in a dictionary.
To add to a dictionary.
To compile a dictionary.
Someone who listens, especially to a speech or a broadcast.
(chiefly Java) A function that runs in response to an event; an event handler.
A person's ear.
An instance or example of using the word "but".
definitions.example: It has to be done – no ifs or buts.

definitions.definition: The outer room of a small two-room cottage.
A limit; a boundary.
The end; especially the larger or thicker end, or the blunt, in distinction from the sharp, end; the butt.
Use the word "but".
definitions.example: But me no buts.

definitions.definition: Merely, only, just.
definitions.example: Christmas comes  but once a year.

definitions.definition: Though, however.
definitions.example: I'll have to go home early but.

definitions.definition: Used as an intensifier.
definitions.example: Nobody, but nobody, crosses me and gets away with it.

definitions.definition: Apart from, except (for), excluding.
definitions.example: Everyone but Father left early.

definitions.definition: (obsolete outside Scotland) Outside of.
On the contrary, rather (as a regular adversative conjunction, introducing a word or clause in contrast or contradiction with the preceding negative clause or sentence).
definitions.example: I am not rich but [I am] poor  not John but Peter went there.

definitions.definition: However, although, nevertheless, on the other hand (introducing a clause contrary to prior belief or in contrast with the preceding clause or sentence).
definitions.example: She is very old but still attractive.

definitions.definition: Except that (introducing a subordinate clause which qualifies a negative statement); also, with omission of the subject of the subordinate clause, acting as a negative relative, "except one that", "except such that".
definitions.example: I cannot but feel offended.

definitions.definition: Without its also being the case that; unless that (introducing a necessary concomitant).
definitions.example: It never rains but it pours.

definitions.definition: Except with; unless with; without.
Only; solely; merely.
Until.
(following a negated expression of improbability) That.
A failure, particularly mechanical; something that has failed
definitions.example: We saw a breakdown by the side of the road.

definitions.definition: A physical collapse or lapse of mental stability
definitions.example: After so much stress, he suffered a breakdown and simply gave up.

definitions.definition: Listing, division or categorization in great detail
definitions.example: Looking at the breakdown of the budget, I see a few items we could cut.

definitions.definition: A detailed description of a forthcoming project, including the characters and roles required.
Breaking of chemical bonds within a compound to produce simpler compounds or elements.
A musical technique by which the music is stripped down, becoming simpler, varying in heaviness depending on the genre.
A loss of organization (of the parts of a system).
A noisy, rapid, shuffling dance engaged in competitively by a number of persons or pairs in succession, common in Southern United States African American music.
Any crude, noisy dance performed by shuffling the feet, usually by one person at a time.
Any rapid bluegrass dance tune, especially featuring a five-string banjo.
definitions.example: "Foggy Mountain Breakdown"

definitions.definition: The percussion break of songs chosen by a DJ for use in hip-hop music.

(plural: data) A measurement of something on a scale understood by both the recorder (a person or device) and the reader (another person or device). The scale is arbitrarily defined, such as from 1 to 10 by ones, 1 to 100 by 0.1, or simply true or false, on or off, yes, no, or maybe, etc.
(plural: data) A fact known from direct observation.
(plural: data) A premise from which conclusions are drawn.
(plural: datums) A fixed reference point, or a coordinate system.
Something given or offered that adds to a larger whole.
An amount of money given toward something.
The act of contributing.
The taking part, often with the idea that it has led to (scientific etc.) progress.
The quality of being transparent; transparence.
Openness; accessibility to scrutiny.
A translucent film-like material with an image imprinted on it, viewable by shining light through it.
A transparent object.
Sufficient accuracy to make the compressed result perceptually indistinguishable from the uncompressed input.
In a proper manner, appropriately, suitably; correctly, justifiably
Entirely; extremely; thoroughly.
definitions.example: I was properly tired after that party.

definitions.definition: Individually; in one's own manner
The act of translating, in its various senses:
The product or end result of an act of translating, in its various senses.
An element of broadcast programming originating away from the station's or show's control room.
To connect to a computer from a remote location.
At a distance; disconnected.
definitions.example: A remote operator may control the vehicle with a wireless handset.

definitions.definition: Distant or otherwise inaccessible.
definitions.example: After his fall from the emperor's favor, the general was posted to a remote outpost.

definitions.definition: (especially with respect to likelihood) Slight.
definitions.example: There was only a remote possibility that we would be rescued as we were far outside of the regular shipping lanes.

definitions.definition: Emotionally detached.
definitions.example: After her mother's death, my friend grew remote for a time while she dealt with her grief.

definitions.definition: A device used to operate an appliance (such as a television), vehicle or mechanical toy from a short distance away.
A means of doing something from a distance.
definitions.example: The bomb was detonated by remote control.

definitions.definition: A muscular organ that pumps blood through the body, traditionally thought to be the seat of emotion.
Emotions, kindness, moral effort, or spirit in general.
definitions.example: The team lost, but they showed a lot of heart.

definitions.definition: The seat of the affections or sensibilities, collectively or separately, as love, hate, joy, grief, courage, etc.; rarely, the seat of the understanding or will; usually in a good sense; personality.
definitions.example: a good, tender, loving, bad, hard, or selfish heart

definitions.definition: Courage; courageous purpose; spirit.
Vigorous and efficient activity; power of fertile production; condition of the soil, whether good or bad.
A term of affectionate or kindly and familiar address.
definitions.example: Listen, dear heart, we must go now.

definitions.definition: Personality, disposition.
definitions.example: a cold heart

definitions.definition: A wight or being.
A conventional shape or symbol used to represent the heart, love, or emotion: ♥ or sometimes <3.
A playing card of the suit hearts featuring one or more heart-shaped symbols.
The twenty-fourth Lenormand card.
The centre, essence, or core.
definitions.example: Buddhists believe that suffering is right at the heart of all life.

definitions.definition: To be fond of. Often bracketed or abbreviated with a heart symbol.
definitions.example: 2008 July 25, "The Media Hearts Obama?", On The Media, National Public Radio

definitions.definition: To give heart to; to hearten; to encourage.
To fill an interior with rubble, as a wall or a breakwater.
To form a dense cluster of leaves, a heart, especially of lettuce or cabbage.
A wise and trusted counselor or teacher
To act as someone's mentor
To a greater degree or extent.
definitions.example: I could no more climb that than fly!

definitions.definition: Used to form the comparative form of adjectives and adverbs.
definitions.example: You're more beautiful than I ever imagined.

definitions.definition: In negative constructions: any further, any longer; any more.
Used in addition to an inflected comparative form.
definitions.example: I was more better at English than you.

definitions.definition: A greater number or quantity (of something).
definitions.example: There isn't enough salt in this. You need to add more.

definitions.definition: An extra or additional quantity (of something).
definitions.example: There aren't many people here yet, but more should be arriving soon.

definitions.definition: A carrot; a parsnip.
A root; stock.
A plant.
To root up.
A smear, smudge or blot
Something that appears hazy or indistinct
A moral stain or blot.
To make indistinct or hazy, to obscure or dim.
definitions.example: to blur a photograph by moving the camera while taking it

definitions.definition: To smear, stain or smudge.
definitions.example: to blur a manuscript by handling it while damp

definitions.definition: To become indistinct.
To cause imperfection of vision in; to dim; to darken.
To sully; to stain; to blemish, as reputation.
To transfer the input focus away from.
In a state of doubt or confusion.
The result or outcome of a cause.
definitions.example: The effect of the hurricane was a devastated landscape.

definitions.definition: Impression left on the mind; sensation produced.
Execution; performance; realization; operation.
An illusion produced by technical means (as in "special effect")
definitions.example: The effect of flying was most convincing.

definitions.definition: (sound engineering) An alteration, or device for producing an alteration, in sound after it has been produced by an instrument.
definitions.example: I just bought a couple of great effects.

definitions.definition: (etc.) A scientific phenomenon, usually named after its discoverer.
definitions.example: Doppler effect

definitions.definition: (usually in the plural) Belongings, usually as personal effects.
Consequence intended; purpose; meaning; general intent; with to.
Reality; actual meaning; fact, as distinguished from mere appearance.
Manifestation; expression; sign.
To make or bring about; to implement.
definitions.example: The best way to effect change is to work with existing stakeholders.
